channel.title: Legends
channel.description:
I just started playing again and yesterday i did plague city, bio-hazard and underground pass. And now im wondering how difficult legends is. On all the guides they say its very hard and very long, but my friend at school said it was maybe 30 minutes tops. So how hard/ long is it?
I define hard as in running through hoards of creatures taking damage constantly, or fighting high levels that are hard to beat. (Even though a 127 monster is the equivalent of a good lvl 80 player)

item.title: Legends
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:37, topic:331039”][quote author=Frell link=topic=427408.msg3142199#msg3142199 date=1267675719]

i remember when people used to do quests for fun, the excitement of figuring stuff out for yourself

Too much of a hassle. Especially if you just want the reward and miss the story line.
[/quote]
its a shame, you’re missing the only part of that game worth playing[/quote]
Debatable. A lot of their ‘back story’ is very bland. A handful of quests are quite enjoyable, but many don’t have anything to add to the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Legends
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:26, topic:331039”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=427408.msg3139736#msg3139736 date=1267383339]
Trick to botting; if you don’t get reported to won’t get banned. Jagex couldn’t give two shits about your activity/what you do until someone reports you for it. Once you have been reported they check all the logs they have on you for the past few weeks or so, checking for anything they can give you an infraction for.
[/quote]
Is this speculation or has this been posted by Jagex somewhere?[/quote]
Well, it’s likely. I botted once for a week straight on pure essence and received no ban, 2 weeks later I get reported for offensive language but banned for macroning.

Read full topic

item.title: Legends
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:28, topic:331039”]Wow. So 46-50 smithing the fastest way will cost 1m…[/quote]Uh, do it with gold ores. Use the gauntlets that you get from the quest, I don’t remember the name, and then you’ll have to smelt like 600 ores and you’d be finished x.D

Read full topic

item.title: Legends
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“the bank, post:29, topic:331039”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=427408.msg3140688#msg3140688 date=1267480774]

Trick to botting; if you don’t get reported to won’t get banned. Jagex couldn’t give two shits about your activity/what you do until someone reports you for it. Once you have been reported they check all the logs they have on you for the past few weeks or so, checking for anything they can give you an infraction for.

Is this speculation or has this been posted by Jagex somewhere?
[/quote]Well, a bit of both. In the PMod forums a JMod said that reporting someone “activates” the macro-detection routine.[/quote]

I got reported at the gem mining… for botting … which i was but luckely i replied to the guy like 2 min after he reported me… That was like 4 days ago and i havent been banned yet

Read full topic

item.title: Legends
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:25, topic:331039”][quote author=TheBeanie link=topic=427408.msg3140672#msg3140672 date=1267480027]

Frell… He cares about RuneScape.

This is my only account and i’ve only kept it to see the new updates they come out with it. I don’t want it to get banned therefore i CARE about it.

If this was a second account i could care the fuck less and bot the hell out of it.

Its my main account too
[/quote]
Probably because you had your real main banned for some reason. If i did i would make a new account and bot it back to what my main was.[/quote]

Nope it is and always has been my main account

Read full topic
